intro: Oxymeris asperifolia, commonly known as the rough-leaved oxymeris, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its rugged, rough-textured leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Oxymeris asperifolia is often found in forest understories and is adapted to humid, shaded environments.
